That is the joys of the internet, people will always insult people as long as they believe thay can get away with it. This group can be a very productive and above all interlectual experience. Unfortunatly if like me you make the odd grammatical error you can also be corrected, which can be a little insulting. In all this is a productive group to be a part of and although I havent posted in a while I always enjoy reading the regulars opinions. I myself moderate on a huge gamingg forum and it can be a little frustrating, but all in all this is a cool group as long as we all stay on subject.....

Nate Ledbetter <ltdomer98@...> wrote:
--- Richardson Paul <umaryu@...> wrote:
> Hi all
> 
> the one thing I hate about mail list and forums is
> because people are sat at keypoards and not
> discussing
> face to face, then there is a tenancy to be very
> insulting and offensive.
> 
> Even moderators can get rude at times, some time a I
> think taking their position as an excuse.

And the one thing this moderator hates is people who
hide in the herd. Especially when I've asked, offline,
for you to list any insults I've directed at you, and
I've tried, repeatedly, to clarify anything you were
misreading. And now, I get publicly threatened on the
list. See below: 

Someone who once insult me on the web
> then
> got a shock some time later when I introduced my
> self.
> The shock was because they thought they were very
> safe
> insulting me 3000 miles away from where I live from
> them. They were not keen at all to insult me then.

*snip* 

> I just think we should all be aware that we may one
> day meet and it may not be too friendly due to our
> behaviour.

This is very junior high school. I'd think a 36 year
old would be above that.
